data.meta_description: Executive Assistant, Mayor & City Manager | City of Whitehorse
data.text:
A wonderful opportunity to grow your career in one of Canada’s most beautiful cities!

Enjoy a highly competitive wage of $36.75 - $43.24 per hour!

Join a supportive team environment with opportunities for growth!

About the City of Whitehorse

Established as the Yukon's capital city in 1953, the City of Whitehorse is home to some of the most spectacular scenery, talented artists, and innovative businesses in Canada.

Situated along the Yukon River on the traditional territory of the Kwanlin Dün First Nation and the Ta’an Kwäch’än Council, over 33,000 call Whitehorse home. The City enjoys a healthy economy thanks to a strong business community, which was recognized when Whitehorse was named the top city for entrepreneurs in 2018 by the Canadian Federation of Independent Business. The City also enjoys a successful working relationship with the area's First Nations and the territorial government.

Environmental sustainability and responsibility have become a key priority for the City. Access to nature remains a top value for residents who can enjoy recreation activities year-round, a vibrant art scene and a multitude of cultures as people from all over the world have decided to settle north of 60. There is a reason why Whitehorse has seen steady growth in population - it’s because it truly is a wonderful place to live, work, and play.

To learn more about Whitehorse, please visit our website by clicking here.

About the Opportunity

We currently have an exciting opportunity for an Executive Assistant, Mayor & City Manager to join our team in Whitehorse, Yukon on a full-time basis.

This position provides complex, confidential administrative support to the Mayor and City Manager. The work includes planning, organizing, and scheduling meetings and events, overseeing and participating in special functions and projects, and maintaining effective public relations between the City including providing information and assistance to the public, other agencies, and internal departments.

More specifically, your duties and responsibilities will include:

Performing administrative support for the Mayor and City Manager, including:

Preparing correspondence including letters, reports, speeches, formal greetings, and press releases

Arranging appointments and meetings

Reviewing and maintaining appointment calendars

Supplying necessary background information as required

Booking travel and hotel accommodations

Following up on correspondence and projects

Researching information

Receiving incoming calls

Preparing expense reports and completing funding proposal applications and requirements for reimbursements

Receiving all manner of requests, queries, and complaints

Liaising with internal staff and external contacts to collaborate on response development

Researching, drafting, tracking and following up on inquiries and responses

Performing high-level work of considerable complexity and sensitivity, serving as the primary liaison between the City and the officials of other governmental agencies

Providing timely, expert advice on protocol requirements by visiting dignitaries, ceremonial events, and special occasions to ensure the delivery of professional and high-quality services

Maintaining effective working relationships with a variety of internal staff and external contacts, including the public

Facilitating coordination of information flow between Mayor, City Manager and Council

Developing and maintaining an effective system of tracking and bringing forward any reoccurring or outstanding matters involving the Mayor and City Manager

Providing input, monitoring and preparing the Mayor’s and City Manager’s departmental budget

Organizing and administering functions, receptions, celebrations and other public relations duties as required

Researching and assisting in special projects as assigned

More About You

In order to qualify for this role, you will need a post-secondary diploma in office or business administration, or equivalent, along with 3 years of senior admin experience, preferably in a municipal/government setting. Alternative combinations of education, training, and experience will also be considered. Knowledge of city structure, functions, and regulations would be an asset.

As our ideal candidate, you have the ability to work independently, establish priorities and exercise tact when dealing with all matters of the position. You have excellent interpersonal and professional communication skills, along with the ability to foster and maintain effective, collaborative relationships among all stakeholders. You have excellent organizational and prioritization skills, are able to multitask, and can maintain accuracy while meeting deadlines.

You are an innovative, forward-thinker, who proactively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions, and takes action when needed. Above all, you have demonstrated confidentiality regarding sensitive information, while being highly detail-oriented, and diligent when putting your skills to the test and building relationships.

About the Benefits

As a valued member of our team, you will be rewarded with a highly competitive wage of $36.75 - $43.24 per hour, based on skills and experience, along with the following benefits:

Extended health and dental coverage

RRSP matching

Paid vacation

Wellness committee that hosts fun events such as snowshoeing

Growth opportunities

Discounts on gym memberships at the Canada Games Centre and for transit bus passes

The opportunity to join a supportive team environment

Relocation assistance available for the right candidate

If you are a hardworking individual looking to grow your career, then we would love to hear from you - Apply Today!
